verses.verse: And the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872> and to Aaron<WH175>, saying unto them<WH559>,
Speak<WH1696> unto the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, These<WH2063> are the animals<WH2416> which you shall eat<WH398> among all the animals<WH929> that are on the earth<WH776>.
Whatever parts<WH6536> the hoof<WH6541>, and is clovenfooted<WH8156>, and chews<WH5927> the cud<WH1625>, among the animals<WH929>, that shall you eat<WH398>.

Nevertheless<WH389> these shall you not eat<WH398> of them that chew<WH5927> the cud<WH1625>, or of them that divide<WH6536> the hoof<WH6541>: as the camel<WH1581>, because he chews<WH5927> the cud<WH1625>, but divides<WH6536> not the hoof<WH6541>; he is unclean unto you<WH2931>.
And the coney<WH8227>, because he chews<WH5927> the cud<WH1625>, but divides<WH6536> not the hoof<WH6541>; he is unclean unto you<WH2931>.
And the hare<WH768>, because he chews<WH5927> the cud<WH1625>, but divides<WH6536> not the hoof<WH6541>; he is unclean unto you<WH2931>.
And the pig<WH2386>, though he divide<WH6536> the hoof<WH6541>, and be clovenfooted<WH8156>, yet he chews<WH1641> not the cud<WH1625>; he is unclean to you<WH2931>.
Of their flesh<WH1320> shall you not eat<WH398>, and their carcass<WH5038> shall you not touch<WH5060>; they are unclean to you<WH2931>.

These shall you eat<WH398> of all that are in the waters<WH4325>: whatever has fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> in the waters<WH4325>, in the seas<WH3220>, and in the rivers<WH5158>, them shall you eat<WH398>.

And all that have not fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> in the seas<WH3220>, and in the rivers<WH5158>, of all that move<WH8318> in the waters<WH4325>, and of any living<WH2416> thing<WH5315> which is in the waters<WH4325>, they shall be an abomination unto you<WH8263>:
They shall be even an abomination<WH8263> unto you<WH398>; you shall not eat of their flesh<WH1320>, but you shall have their carcasses<WH5038> in abomination<WH8262>.
Whatever has no fins<WH5579> nor scales<WH7193> in the waters<WH4325>, that shall be an abomination unto you<WH8263>.

And these are they which you shall have in abomination<WH8262> among<WH4480> the birds<WH5775>; they shall not be eaten<WH398>, they are an abomination<WH8263>: the eagle<WH5404>, and the ossifrage<WH6538>, and the ospray<WH5822>,
And the vulture<WH1676>, and the kite<WH344> after his kind<WH4327>;
Every raven<WH6158> after his kind<WH4327>;
And the owl<WH1323>, and the night hawk<WH8464>, and the cuckow<WH7828>, and the hawk<WH5322> after his kind<WH4327>,
And the little owl<WH3563>, and the cormorant<WH7994>, and the great owl<WH3244>,
And the swan<WH8580>, and the pelican<WH6893>, and the gier eagle<WH7360>,
And the stork<WH2624>, the heron<WH601> after her kind<WH4327>, and the lapwing<WH1744>, and the bat<WH5847>.
All birds<WH5775> that creep<WH8318>, going<WH1980> upon all four<WH702>, shall be an abomination unto you<WH8263>.

Yet these may you eat<WH398> of every flying<WH5775> creeping<WH8318> thing that goes<WH1980> upon all four<WH702>, which have legs<WH3767> above<WH4605> their feet<WH7272>, to leap<WH5425> with<WH2004> upon the earth<WH776>;

Even these of them you may eat<WH398>; the locust<WH697> after his kind<WH4327>, and the bald locust<WH5556> after his kind<WH4327>, and the beetle<WH2728> after his kind<WH4327>, and the grasshopper<WH2284> after his kind<WH4327>.
But all other flying<WH5775> creeping things<WH8318>, which have four<WH702> feet<WH7272>, shall be an abomination unto you<WH8263>.
And for these you shall be unclean<WH2930>: whoever touches<WH5060> the carcass<WH5038> of them shall be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>.
And whoever carries<WH5375> any of the carcass<WH5038> of them shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899>, and be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>.

The carcasses of every animal<WH929> which divides<WH6536> the hoof<WH6541>, and is not clovenfooted<WH8157>, nor chews<WH5927> the cud<WH1625>, are unclean<WH2931> unto you<WH5060>: every one that touches them shall be unclean<WH2930>.

And whatever<WH3605> goes<WH1980> upon his paws<WH3709>, among all manner of animals<WH2416> that go<WH1980> on all four<WH702>, those are unclean<WH2931> unto you<WH5060>: whoever touches their carcass<WH5038> shall be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>.
And he that carries<WH5375> the carcass<WH5038> of them shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899>, and be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>: they are unclean unto you<WH2931>.

These also shall be unclean<WH2931> unto you among the creeping things<WH8318> that creep<WH8317> upon the earth<WH776>; the weasel<WH2467>, and the mouse<WH5909>, and the tortoise<WH6632> after his kind<WH4327>,
And the ferret<WH604>, and the chameleon<WH3581>, and the lizard<WH3911>, and the snail<WH2546>, and the mole<WH8580>.
These are unclean<WH2931> to you among all that creep<WH8318>: whoever does touch<WH5060> them<WH4194>, when they be dead, shall be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>.

And upon whatever any of them<WH4194>, when they are dead, does fall<WH5307>, it shall be unclean<WH2930>; whether it be any vessel<WH3627> of wood<WH6086>, or clothes<WH899>, or skin<WH5785>, or sack<WH8242>, whatever vessel<WH3627> it be<WH4399>, where any work is done<WH6213>, it must be put<WH935> into water<WH4325>, and it shall be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>; so it shall be cleansed<WH2891>.
And every earthen<WH2789> vessel<WH3627>, whereinto any of them falls<WH5307>, whatever is in it shall be unclean<WH2930>; and you shall break it<WH7665>.

Of all food<WH400> which may be eaten<WH398>, that on which such water<WH4325> comes<WH935> shall be unclean<WH2930>: and all drink<WH4945> that may be drunk<WH8354> in every such vessel<WH3627> shall be unclean<WH2930>.

And every thing whereupon any part of their carcass<WH5038> falls<WH5307> shall be unclean<WH2930>; whether it be oven<WH8574>, or ranges<WH3600> for pots<WH5422>, they shall be broken down: for they are unclean<WH2931>, and shall be unclean unto you<WH2931>.
Nevertheless a fountain<WH4599> or pit<WH953>, where there is plenty<WH4723> of water<WH4325>, shall be clean<WH2889>: but that which touches<WH5060> their carcass<WH5038> shall be unclean<WH2930>.
And if any part of their carcass<WH5038> fall<WH5307> upon any sowing<WH2221> seed<WH2233> which is to be sown<WH2232>, it shall be clean<WH2889>.
But if any water<WH4325> be put<WH5414> upon the seed<WH2233>, and any part of their carcass<WH5038> fall<WH5307> on it<WH2931>, it shall be unclean unto you.
And if any animal<WH929>, of which you may eat<WH402>, die<WH4191>; he that touches<WH5060> the carcass<WH5038> there shall be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>.

And he that eat<WH398> of the carcass<WH5038> of it shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899>, and be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>: he also that beareth<WH5375> the carcass<WH5038> of it shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899>, and be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>.
And every creeping thing<WH8318> that creeps<WH8317> upon the earth<WH776> shall be an abomination<WH8263>; it shall not be eaten<WH398>.

Whatever goes<WH1980> upon the belly<WH1512>, and whatever goes<WH1980> upon all four<WH702>, or whatever has more<WH7235> feet<WH7272> among all creeping things<WH8318> that creep<WH8317> upon the earth<WH776>, them you shall not eat<WH398>; for they are an abomination<WH8263>.

You shall not make<WH8262> yourselves<WH5315> abominable<WH8262> with any creeping thing<WH8318> that creeps<WH8317>, neither shall you make yourselves unclean<WH2933> with them<WH2930>, that you should be defiled thereby.

For I am the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>: you shall therefore sanctify yourselves<WH6942>, and you shall be holy<WH6918>; for I am holy<WH6918>: neither shall you defile<WH2930> yourselves<WH5315> with any manner of creeping thing<WH8318> that creeps<WH7430> upon the earth<WH776>.
For I am the Lord<WH3068> that brings<WH5927> you up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, to be your God<WH430>: you shall therefore be holy<WH6918>, for I am holy<WH6918>.

This is the law<WH8451> of the animals<WH929>, and of the bird<WH5775>, and of every living<WH2416> creature<WH5315> that moves<WH7430> in the waters<WH4325>, and of every creature<WH5315> that creeps<WH8317> upon the earth<WH776>:
To make a difference<WH914> between the unclean<WH2931> and the clean<WH2889>, and between the animal<WH2416> that may be eaten<WH398> and the animal<WH2416> that may not be eaten<WH398>.
